item.title: The eco-conscious GROHE smart water system is gaining traction in Asia
item.description:
Source: GROHE. The GROHE Blue system in action. GROHE Blue, a smart water system, has become increasingly popular in Asia since a May 2014 study revealed its smaller carbon footprint compared to bottled mineral water. The study estimated that the GROHE Blue system generates 17.96 g CO2-eq/liter, significantly less than the 70 to 600 g CO2-eq/liter produced by bottled mineral water. item.title: Google prefers websites that are optimized for mobile devices. Have you taken any steps to ensure your site is mobile-friendly?
item.description:
World Markets Korea, a Seoul-based online marketing firm, has outlined some of the factors Google now considers when evaluating websites for mobile friendliness. These include text size, spacing between links, and whether the content fits comfortably on a mobile screen. Google uses these criteria to determine if a website is “Mobile Friendly.” The company recommends that businesses engage their web designers to update their sites accordingly. item.description:
